required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Performance of Different Resin Infiltration Materials on White Spot Lesions: Clinical and Laboratory Assessments
clinical_study.official_title: Performance of Different Resin Infiltration Materials on White Spot Lesions: Clinical and Laboratory Assessments

brief_summary.textblock: The study is a clinical controlled trial. Ethical approval will be obtained from Imam Abdulrahman bin Faisal University, Dammam. The study participants will be recruited from the dental hospital and conducted between November 2020 to November 2020. This will be a single-center, randomized, single blinded with a 1:1:1 allocation ratio for the application of Icon® resin infiltration, MI Paste Plus and both treatments

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from 0 day, 1 month and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Pre-treatment and post-treatment color changing (L*A*B values) of digital photographs using the Commission Internationale de l'Eclairage (CIE) system

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from 0 day, 1 month and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Post-treatment patient satisfaction using the patient satisfaction scale

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from 0 day, 1 month and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Post-treatment change in caries lesion status using ICDAS II

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from 0 day, 1 month and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Number of cracks assessed by enamel surface analysis via silicone replicas using CLSM

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from 0 day, 1 month and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Pre-treatment and post-treatment microbial composition of plaque samples. Samples will be stored at -80 °C until DNA extractions will be performed and run the 16S rRNA sequencing.

primary_outcome.measure: Effects on clinical parameter: sensitivity to percussion
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from 0 day, 1 month and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Pre-treatment and post-treatment effects on sensitivity to percussion by end blunted instrument.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from 0 day, 1 month and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Esthetic improvement through objective assessments using a visual analogue

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from 0 day, 1 month and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Pre-treatment esthetic self perception by the subjects using questionnaire

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from 0 day, 1 month and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Pre-treatment and post-treatment white spot lesion size

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from 0 day, 1 month and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Number of fracture assessed by enamel surface analysis via silicone replicas using CLSM

primary_outcome.measure: Effects on clinical parameter: prolonged response to hot or cold.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from 0 day, 1 month and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Pre-treatment and post-treatment effects on response to hot or cold by cold test

intervention.description: low viscosity resin that can flow through the pores in the enamel surface
s a superior form of fluoride ions as it also contains CPP-ACP, enhances mineral release without encouraging the formation of calculus.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are willing and able to observe good oral hygiene and attend for the study visits.
- Subjects with ≥1 visible and accessible early caries lesion present.
- No prior white spot lesion treatment utilized except tooth brushing with fluoridated toothpaste.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active carious lesions
- Facial surface restorations
- Deciduous teeth
- Enamel alteration (fluorosis, opacity, hypocalcification, hypoplasia)
- Intrinsic and extrinsic strains
- Physically and mentally challenged volunteers
- Patients with systemic diseases under medication
- Smokers
